description: From Middle English supporter, supportour, equivalent to support +â€Ž -er.

definitionGroups.group: A person who gives support to someone or something.

entries.meaning: A person who supports, promotes, advocates or champions a cause, movement, or political party; an adherent.
A person who provides moral or physical support to another; an attendant participating in a ceremony or procession.
(sports) Someone who is a fan of a certain sports team or sportsperson.
examples: More than 10,000 supporters attended the last match.

entries.meaning: Something that supports a structure such as a building or a sculpture.
(heraldry) An animal or figure that supports a shield in a coat of arms.
A garter worn around the leg to support a sock or stocking.
examples: From the radiator, where he was attaching supporters to his socks, Zooey glanced up at her.
